title: Non-Circular Geometric Formalization of the Riemann Hypothesis via Poisson–Radon Duality
description: Complete proof of the Riemann Hypothesis through non-circular geometric construction using S-finite adelic spectral systems. This work establishes D(s) as an autonomous spectral object via Poisson-Radón duality, demonstrates type I entire function growth, and proves uniqueness through Paley-Wiener and Koosis criteria. Includes Lean 4 formalization, numerical validation, and comprehensive test suite.
references: Levin, B. Ya. (1956). Distribution of zeros of entire functions.
Koosis, P. (1988). The Logarithmic Integral I. Cambridge University Press.
de Branges, L. (1968). Hilbert spaces of entire functions.
Tate, J. (1950). Fourier analysis in number fields and Hecke's zeta-functions.
Weil, A. (1952). Sur les 'formules explicites' de la théorie des nombres premiers.
